byline.contributor: Timothy Williams reported from Cleveland, and Mitch Smith from Chicago.
byline.original: By TIMOTHY WILLIAMS and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Grand jury declines to charge white Cleveland Police Officer Timothy Loehmann, who fatally shot 12-year-old African-American Tamir Rice in 2014, while child was holding pellet gun; decision ends more than year of inquiry into case that fueled national anger over killing of African-Americans by white officers.
lead_paragraph: The 12-year-old boy was killed as he was playing with a replica gun in a park. Relatives and activists, who called the shooting senseless, had sought charges in the case.

headline.main: Cleveland Officer Will Not Face Charges in Tamir Rice Shooting Death
headline.print_headline: Jurors Decline Charges in Death of Cleveland Boy

snippet: The 12-year-old boy was killed as he was playing with a replica gun in a park. Relatives and activists, who called the shooting senseless, had sought charges in the case.
